main event: Two witnesses observed a round, flat object in the sky over Dayton, Ohio, on May 3, 1949.
interesting points: The object was described as being gold or bronze in color., It flashed brightly in the sun while appearing dull at other times., The object was faster than aircraft observed at the time., Witnesses reported that the object climbed rapidly and disappeared in the red twilight., One witness compared the object's motion to a 'lid of a large tin can sailing the air'.
witness description: Mrs. C and another unnamed individual, both housewives
